title: Lore team, please update Miss Fortune's story as well
body:
Because I hate the fact that such heroic character with such a great VO seduces or even sells her body to sailors in order to have a team. She's sounds and acts like a rare type of cocky and bold female characters (Actually I can't remember any except {{champion:254}} ) and the fact that the only thing she relies on is her body and attractiveness is killing me. I mean, why would she even sound like a heroic girl then, instead of a whining courtesan that she's being described in her story? And before anybody yells about "feminazi" - I'm a guy.
**I mean it. This is the only time when I actually ask for a retcon, be it made of 3-4 sentences or not. Because this is absolutely ridiculous. **

replies.body:
Just my opinion, but I pity the person who underestimates Sarah Fortune because of her looks.  I've seen women who put on their clothes and makeup like a knight puts on armor and straps on a sword - making them armed and exceptionally dangerous.  But there's usually a very sharp mind behind those eyes.

I believe Jaredan is hoping to get some more of the biographic stories out for several of the champs, and is doing a test of the (seriously!) long awaited system to publish them next week (that test will involve some of the stories we've already seen for Shurima champs, but a test is a test!)  I'd guess that the one for Sarah won't be N-hundred words of her batting her eyelashes and giggling at boys :)

Or giggling at girls.

*shamelessly headcanons in the corner*
Whatever floats your boat.

She already is a brave and awesome character. A beautiful and intelligent woman is one of the most dangerous things in the world. And you would have to be quite brave and exceptionally skilled to successfully pull that off in a city filled with Pirates.
Which she already is portrayed as. While you are obviously blind of it and see only 1 part of her character and try to present it as her whole character.

i absolutely love the first part of this reply, it's like one of THE most vital parts about MF that most people seem to overlook!

I don't think there's anything wrong with Miss Fortune knowing that she's a really attractive woman and abusing that, I mean, realistically that would be wrong but It's awesome lore and gives her more unique personality. Sure Caitlyn, Ashe or whoever is beautiful, but they don't use their looks like Miss Fortune does. 

My main issue is that they don't really give a lot on how she became so powerful. They basically said she's good with guns, but is she like the best gunslinger in Bilgewater or something? I want a more in-depth look on how strong she really is in combat. Is she really agile? Does she have godly aim? Did her parents or a friend train her in gun-shooting and combat?

Overall I really like Miss Fortune, she can seem like an innocent, harmless woman but obviously she isn't called one of Valoran's greatest Bounty Hunters for no reason and isn't afraid to draw some blood.

What's unique about seducing? Don't we already have these {{champion:103}} {{champion:60}} {{champion:69}} characters?

I can agree with everything else though. We need more characters who show their strength, their skills, their will and their ambitions. And if Miss Fortune has pushed that line further somehow, she would become much greater as a character.

I don't think Cassiopeia seduces people, and I think Elise just flat out manipulates people.

It's really hard to talk about the lore, when relatively none of it exists.

Cass does seduce, she was a Seductress of Noxus, pretty much.  Elise is no seductress.

Ahri is a very interesting area...

How did Cassiopeia seduce people, I don't really know much of her lore aside from her Shurima story?

And Ahri is Ahri. Does she even have lore besides she magically turned into a human-fox hybrid and then decides to seduce people because why not.

To use the summary in her contemporary short bio for simplicity's sake:

_"she was once a beautiful and cunning temptress capable of manipulating the hardest heart."_

Before the incident that caused her transformation, in either version of her lore, Cassiopeia was someone who served Noxus and her family's interest by using her looks, wit and understanding of courtly behaviour and high society to manipulate others and pry valuable secrets from them. Her old lore stated plainly that she "could never be found far from the arm of any foreign dignitary," referred to her directly as a seductress and called her time in the company of the Freljordian diplomat who cursed her a tryst - a private, romantic rendezvous between lovers.
Cassiopeia was a spy that seduced people to get information out of them.

What is unique about using a sword? What is unique about fire? Seduction has historically been one of the hardest to counter weapons.

So:

 _'No bounty was too difficult or too dangerous for her feminine charm and her renowned use of her twin pistols, "Shock and Awe". Her success gave her the means to legitimately purchase her own ship - with a little flirtatious haggling, of course'_ 

...reads as selling her body in your book and makes her a 'whining courtesan'?

I don't disagree that her sexual nature is perhaps too big a focus, particularly in her VO, but I'm not sure why we're jumping from that sort of discussion to saying that she can't be a hero or denigrating her character for acting that way.
Please dont, they're gonna make her thing a paragraph and thats it

In JoJo's Bizarre Adventure, Joseph Joestar, being an incredibly muscular guy, is willing to dress up as a woman in an attempt to seduce the guards and slip into a Nazi base (that's not mention the amount of men in suggestive poses/outfit/position this series have, still among the most well received show to be ever created). Well obviously he failed plan A by default but you get the point why I brought this up.

Because one is willing to sexualise him/herself doesn't necessarily mean he/she loses any self value, really some people need to get over the great gender debate.

I remember that, but that's really different. It was obvious that a giant muscular guy will fail at disguise, that scene was made for a pure comedy, while MF is being built on that type of things and she is not cross-dressing in order to get on ship or something. Can you feel the difference? But yeah, I get your point.

Later on we get a guy wearing fishnet (not exact but it gives the impression), guy wearing thongs and all sort of stuff like that.

That still doesn't stop people from liking the characters, because whether or not a character is sexualised, if he/she is cool enough, they attract fans and it's pretty simple as that.

If MF is willing to go out seduce people, so be it, she seems like the type who would do that anyway, it isn't really the case of "it doesn't make sense on this character" tbh.

EDIT: Nami in One Piece also employs the seductive tactics to get past obstacles from time to time, doesn't that make her less smart, capable or respected.

Because JoJo is ALL about being fabulous/non-straight/funny/over-the-top. League of Legends is not JJBA.
Same thing would be wrong if a male character like Garen with all his talk about JUSTIIICE would have a story about him being a male prostitute in order to become a noble warrior. It's. Just. Not. Right.

* Griffith from Berserk sold himself once (or twice) as a prostitute in order to get money to form an army (which was also when he discovered he was actually gay but whatever), if that's what you're looking for.
* As I mentioned earlier, Nami from One Piece.
* Yoko from TTGL. Great character and well respected, despite being sexualised from the get go.
* Kill la Kill. A seemingly chaotic series with quite a few messages that are relevant in the real world, all of the main cast is sexualised, male and female, old and young.
* The female ghoul who owns a bar in Tokyo Ghoul (forgot her name), she is manipulative as sin and utilises her female beauty in conjunction with faked hospitality in attempts to dig more info when the target is less alerted. Rize also uses seduction to lure preys into her territory to be horribly murdered to eat, she is also very strong. And well, the "Nut Cracker".
* Lottie and Zwei from Pandora Hearts are both self sexualising characters, doesn't make them less terrifying to get into trouble with.
* In the manga, "Eden, its an endless world", from what I can remember there is a cutting edge smart female hacker who is pretty much a whore, and another female who chose to be a prostitute, with her own ideals backing her up.

None of the characters mentioned above loses self worth because of some sexual incidents or portrayal they're put into.

It's only a problem when the action performed by a character is not matching with his/her own personality, otherwise there is nothing wrong with it. If MF is just the showy type who would choose that seducing routine to achieve certain purposes from time to time (judging from her dressing attire I don't think it's unfair to assume so), I don't see the problem with it.

The main problem is that LoL lacks characters who do the opposite of playing on someone's feelings or weaknesses. As I've mentioned, there's only one female character with a cocky and positive persona (and very charismatic) who achieves her goals by simply "doooing it", be it hard or even painful. It would make MF much greater character, but it just pushes her back into the rest of others and makes her look really blank.

But in particularly MF's case, she really is the type who would go out abusing her beauty to achieve things quicker with less effort, it's just who she is.

I tbh won't worry about it too much unless Riot decided to sexualise say Riven, then yeah that's gonna have an issue with me. But on MF I think its totally fine imho.

EDIT: if they ever wanna revamp her personality, start with her costume and personal habits first, it just wouldn't make sense to have a confident yet non-showy character to wear almost topless and tight jeans that half shows the butt, while spamming near erotic/ suggestive gestures and all that whenever she could.

The point was that his sexuality or him doing that stuff did not make him a lesser character. It just added to it.
